00017 /**
00018  * tree. Each node has variable number of child nodes, the node is embeddable (like ring list).
00019  * This tree is especially suited for parse trees.
00020  */
00021 typedef struct tagTREENODE {
00022         struct tagTREENODE *parent;
00023         
00024         struct tagTREENODE *nextlevel_first;
00025 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00026         struct tagTREENODE *nextlevel_last;
00027 #endif
00028         struct tagTREENODE *right;
00029 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LEFT      
00030         struct tagTREENODE *left;
00031 #endif
00032 } TREENODE;
00033 
00034 M_INLINE void TREE_init_root(TREENODE *tree)
00035 {
00036         tree->right = tree->parent = tree->nextlevel_first = 0;
00037 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LEFT
00038         tree->left = 0;
00039 #endif
00040 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00041         tree->nextlevel_last = 0;
00042 #endif
00043 }
00044 
00045 M_INLINE TREENODE *TREE_parent(TREENODE *node)
00046 {
00047         return node->parent;
00048 }
00049 
00050 
00051 M_INLINE TREENODE *TREE_left_sibling(TREENODE *node)
00052 {
00053 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LEFT
00054         return node->left;
00055 #else
00056         TREENODE *tmp;
00057 
00058         if (!node->parent) {
00059                 return 0;
00060         }
00061         tmp = node->parent->nextlevel_first;
00062         if (tmp == node) {
00063                 return 0;
00064         }
00065         while(tmp && tmp->right != node) {
00066                 tmp = tmp->right;
00067         }
00068         return tmp;
00069 #endif
00070 }
00071 
00072 M_INLINE TREENODE *TREE_right_sibling(TREENODE *node)
00073 {
00074         return node->right;
00075 }
00076 
00077 M_INLINE TREENODE *TREE_leftmost_sibling(TREENODE *node)
00078 {
00079         TREENODE *parent = node->parent;
00080         if (parent) {
00081                 return parent->nextlevel_first;
00082         }
00083         return 0;
00084 }
00085 
00086 M_INLINE TREENODE *TREE_rightmost_sibling(TREENODE *node)
00087 {
00088 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00089         TREENODE *parent = node->parent;
00090         if (parent) {
00091                 return parent->nextlevel_last;
00092         }
00093         return 0;
00094 #else
00095         while(node->right) {
00096                 node = node->right;
00097         }
00098 #endif
00099         return node;
00100 }
00101 
00102 M_INLINE TREENODE *TREE_first_child(TREENODE *node)
00103 {
00104         return node->nextlevel_first;
00105 }
00106 
00107 M_INLINE TREENODE *TREE_last_child(TREENODE *node)
00108 {
00109 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00110         return node->nextlevel_last;
00111 #else
00112         return TREE_rightmost_sibling(node->nextlevel_first);
00113 #endif
00114 }

00117 
00118 /* insert function -> new element next level is initialised hereby to zero ? option? new function? */
00119 
00120 M_INLINE int TREE_insert_right_sibling(TREENODE *current, TREENODE *newnode, int node_is_leaf)
00121 {
00122         TREENODE *parent = current->parent;
00123 
00124         if (!parent) {
00125                 return -1;
00126         }
00127         if (node_is_leaf) {
00128                 TREE_init_root(newnode);
00129         }
00130 
00131 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00132         if (parent->nextlevel_last == current) {
00133                 parent->nextlevel_last = newnode;
00134         }
00135 #endif
00136 
00137         newnode->parent = parent;
00138         
00139 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LEFT
00140         newnode->left  = current;
00141         if (current->right) {
00142                 current->right->left = newnode;
00143         }
00144 #endif
00145         newnode->right = current->right;
00146         current->right = newnode;
00147 
00148 
00149 
00150         return 0;
00151 }
00152 
00153 
00154 M_INLINE int TREE_insert_left_sibling(TREENODE *current, TREENODE *newnode, int node_is_leaf)
00155 {
00156         TREENODE *parent = current->parent;
00157         if (!parent) {
00158                 return -1;
00159         }
00160 
00161         if (node_is_leaf) {
00162                 TREE_init_root(newnode);
00163         }
00164 
00165         if (parent->nextlevel_first == current) {
00166                 parent->nextlevel_first = newnode;
00167         }
00168 
00169         newnode->parent = parent;
00170 
00171 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LEFT
00172         if (current->left) {
00173                 current->left->right = newnode;
00174         }
00175 #endif
00176         newnode->right = current;
00177 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LEFT      
00178         newnode->left = current->left;
00179         current->left = newnode;
00180 #endif
00181 
00182 
00183 
00184         return 0;
00185 }
00186 
00187 typedef enum {
00188   TREE_INSERT_FIRST,
00189   TREE_INSERT_LAST,
00190 
00191 } TREE_INSERT_MODE;
00192 
00193 M_INLINE void TREE_insert_child(TREENODE *parent, TREENODE *newnode, TREE_INSERT_MODE mode, int node_is_leaf )
00194 {       
00195         /* init new node */
00196         if (node_is_leaf) {
00197                 newnode->nextlevel_first = 0;
00198 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00199                 newnode->nextlevel_last = 0;
00200 #endif
00201         }
00202         newnode->parent = parent;
00203         newnode->right = 0;
00204 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LEFT
00205         newnode->left = 0;
00206 #endif  
00207 
00208         
00209         if (!parent->nextlevel_first) {         
00210 
00211                 /* insert as first child */
00212                 //newnode->nextlevel_first = parent->nextlevel_first;
00213                 parent->nextlevel_first = newnode;
00214 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00215                 //newnode->nextlevel_last = parent->nextlevel_last;
00216                 parent->nextlevel_last = newnode;
00217 #endif
00218                 
00219         } else {
00220 
00221                 /* insert as sibling */
00222                 switch(mode) {
00223                         case TREE_INSERT_FIRST: {
00224                                         TREE_insert_left_sibling(parent->nextlevel_first,newnode, 0);
00225                                 }
00226                                 break;
00227                         case TREE_INSERT_LAST:
00228 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00229                                 TREE_insert_right_sibling( parent->nextlevel_last,newnode, 0);
00230 #else
00231                                 TREE_insert_right_sibling( TREE_rightmost_sibling(parent->nextlevel_first), newnode, 0);
00232 #endif
00233 
00234                                 break;
00235                 }
00236         }
00237 
00238 }
00239 
00240 
00241 M_INLINE void TREE_merge_childs(TREENODE *parent, TREE_INSERT_MODE mode, TREENODE *newnode)
00242 {       
00243         TREENODE *ch;
00244 
00245         switch(mode) {
00246 
00247         case TREE_INSERT_LAST:  
00248                 ch = TREE_first_child(newnode);
00249                 if (!ch) {
00250                         return;
00251                 }
00252 
00253                 while(ch) {
00254                         TREE_insert_child(parent, ch, TREE_INSERT_LAST, 0 );
00255                         ch = TREE_right_sibling(ch);
00256                 }
00257                 break;
00258 
00259         case TREE_INSERT_FIRST: 
00260                 ch = TREE_last_child(newnode);
00261                 if (!ch) {
00262                         return;
00263                 }
00264 
00265                 while(ch) {
00266                         TREE_insert_child(parent, ch, TREE_INSERT_FIRST, 0 );
00267                         ch = TREE_left_sibling(ch);
00268                 }
00269                 break;
00270         }
00271 }

00273 
00274 M_INLINE TREENODE * TREE_unlink_node(TREENODE *node)
00275 {
00276         TREENODE *tmp,*tmp_next, *tmp_last;
00277 
00278         if (!node->parent) {
00279                 return 0;
00280         }
00281 
00282         /* wrong */
00283         tmp = node->parent;
00284         if (tmp && tmp->nextlevel_first == node) {
00285 
00286                 if (!node->nextlevel_first) {
00287                         tmp->nextlevel_first = node->right;
00288                         goto sdel;
00289                 }
00290 
00291                 tmp->nextlevel_first = node->nextlevel_first;                           
00292                 tmp_next = tmp->nextlevel_first;
00293                 tmp_last = TREE_rightmost_sibling(tmp_next);
00294 
00295                 tmp_last->right = node->right;
00296 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LEFT
00297                 if (node->right) {
00298                         node->right->left = tmp_last;
00299                 }
00300 #endif
00301                 do {
00302                         tmp_next->parent = tmp;
00303                         if (tmp_next == tmp_last) {
00304                                 break;
00305                         }
00306                         tmp_next = tmp_next->right;
00307                 } while(tmp_next);
00308 
00309                 return node;
00310         }
00311 
00312 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00313         if (tmp && tmp->nextlevel_last == node) {
00314 
00315                 if (!node->nextlevel_last) {
00316                         tmp->nextlevel_last = TREE_left_sibling(node);
00317                         goto sdel;
00318                 }
00319 
00320                 tmp->nextlevel_last = node->nextlevel_last;     
00321                 tmp_next = tmp->nextlevel_last;
00322                 tmp_last = TREE_leftmost_sibling(tmp_next);
00323 
00324 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LEFT
00325                 tmp_last->left = node->left;
00326 #endif
00327                 TREE_left_sibling(node)->right = tmp_last;
00328 
00329                 do {
00330                         tmp_last->parent = tmp;
00331                         if (tmp_next == tmp_last) {
00332                                 break;
00333                         }
00334                         tmp_last = tmp_last->right;
00335                 } while(tmp_last);                                      
00336 
00337                 return node;
00338         }
00339 #endif
00340 
00341 sdel:
00342 
00343 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LEFT
00344         tmp = node->right;
00345         if (tmp) {
00346                 tmp->left = node->left;
00347         }
00348 #endif
00349 
00350         tmp = TREE_left_sibling(node);
00351         if (tmp) {
00352                 tmp->right = node->right;
00353         }
00354 
00355         return node;
00356 }

00360 typedef void  (*TREE_VISITOR_V) (TREENODE *entry, void *context);
00361 
00362 typedef enum {
00363   TREE_PREORDER,
00364   TREE_POSTORDER,
00365 
00366 } TREE_VISIT_EVENT;
00367 
00368 typedef int  (*TREE_VISITOR_EXT_V) (TREENODE *entry, TREE_VISIT_EVENT visit, void *context);
00369 
00370 
00371 #define TREE_FOREACH_CHILD(current, node) \
00372         for((current) = TREE_first_child(node); \
00373                 (current); \
00374                 (current) = TREE_right_sibling(current)) 
00375 
00376 #define TREE_FOREACH_CHILD_REVERSE(current, node) \
00377         for((current) = TREE_last_child(node); \
00378                 (current); \
00379                 (current) = TREE_left_sibling(current)) 
00380 
00381 
00382 M_INLINE size_t TREE_count_child_nodes( TREENODE *current)
00383 {
00384         size_t ret = 0;
00385         TREENODE *c;
00386 
00387         TREE_FOREACH_CHILD(c,current) {
00388                 ret++;
00389         }
00390         return ret;
00391 }

00393 /*
00394  a
00395  |
00396  b-d-g
00397  | |
00398  c e-f
00399 */
00400 M_INLINE TREENODE *TREE_preorder_next(TREENODE *current)
00401 {
00402         if (current->nextlevel_first) {
00403                 current = current->nextlevel_first;
00404         } else {
00405                 if (current->right) {
00406                         current = current->right;
00407                 } else {
00408                         while(current->parent) {
00409                                 current = current->parent;
00410                                 if (current->right) {
00411                                         current = current->right;
00412                                         break;
00413                                 }
00414                         }
00415                 }
00416         }
00417 
00418         return current;
00419 }
00420

00425                 current = current->nextlevel_first;

00427                 if (current->right) {
00428                         current = current->right;
00429                 } else {
00430                         while(current->parent) {
00431

00448 /**
00449  * @brief iterate over all elements of a list of child nodes, callback is invoked for either element of the list. list is traversed from first element to the last element.
00450  * @param lst (in) node in a tree (parent of enumerated childs).
00451  * @param eval (in) callback that is called to visit each set (or cleared) bit.
00452  * @param context (in) pointer that is passed as context on each invocation of callback.
00453  * @param save_from_del (in) if non zero then callback can remove the current link from the list (a bit slower); if null then not; if zero then can't remove the current link from the list.
00454  */
00455 M_INLINE void TREE_foreach_child( TREENODE *lst, TREE_VISITOR_V eval, void *context)
00456 {
00457     TREENODE *cur;
00458 
00459         if (!eval) {
00460           return;
00461         }
00462 
00463         TREE_FOREACH_CHILD( cur, lst) {
00464                 eval( cur, context );
00465         }
00466         
00467 }
00468 
00469 
00470 
00471 M_INLINE void TREE_foreach_child_reverse( TREENODE *lst, TREE_VISITOR_V eval, void *context)
00472 {
00473     TREENODE *cur;
00474 
00475         if (!eval) {
00476           return;
00477         }
00478 
00479 
00480         TREE_FOREACH_CHILD_REVERSE( cur,lst) {
00481                 eval( cur, context );
00482         }
00483         
00484 }

00486 /**
00487  * @brief find an element within the list of child nodes. callback is invoked for each element of the list, in forward direction from first element to last element; when the callback returns non zero value the iteration stops as we have found what we searched for.
00488  * 
00489  * @param tree (in) node in a tree (parent of enumerated childs).
00490  * @param eval (in) callback that is called to visit each set (or cleared) bit.
00491  * @param context (in) pointer that is passed as context on each invocation of callback.
00492  * @param retval (out) optional - the first non zero value returned by eval callback, if NULL then ignored.
00493  * @return the list element that has matched (i.e. element that has been found).
00494  *
00495  */
00496 M_INLINE TREENODE * TREE_findif_child( TREENODE *tree, TREE_VISITOR eval, void *context, int32_t *retval)
00497 {
00498         int ret;
00499     TREENODE *cur;
00500 
00501         if (retval) {
00502                 *retval = 0;
00503         }
00504 
00505         if (!eval) {
00506                 return 0;
00507         }
00508         
00509 
00510         TREE_FOREACH_CHILD( cur, tree) {
00511                 ret = eval( cur, context );
00512                 if (ret) {
00513                         if (retval) {
00514                                 *retval = ret;
00515                         }
00516                         return cur;
00517                 }
00518         }
00519 
00520         return 0;
00521 }
00522 
00523 M_INLINE TREENODE * TREE_findif_child_reverse( TREENODE *tree, TREE_VISITOR eval, void *context, int32_t *retval)
00524 {
00525         int ret;
00526     TREENODE *cur;
00527 
00528         if (retval) {
00529                 *retval = 0;
00530         }
00531 
00532         if (!eval) {
00533                 return 0;
00534         }
00535         
00536 
00537         TREE_FOREACH_CHILD_REVERSE( cur, tree) {
00538                 ret = eval( cur, context );
00539                 if (ret) {
00540                         if (retval) {
00541                                 *retval = ret;
00542                         }
00543                         return cur;
00544                 }
00545         }
00546 
00547         return 0;
00548 }

00551 #define TREE_FOREACH_PREORDER(current, tree)\
00552 {\
00553         TREENODE *TREE_nextnode##next;\
00554         current = TREE_preorder_next((tree));\
00555         if (current)\
00556                 for( TREE_nextnode##next =  TREE_preorder_next(current);\
00557                             (current) && current != (tree); \
00558                                 (current) = TREE_nextnode##next, TREE_nextnode##next =  TREE_preorder_next(current)) {
00559 
00560                 
00561 #define TREE_FOREACH_PREORDER_END\
00562         }\
00563 }

00568 /*
00569  f
00570  |
00571  b-d-e
00572  | |
00573  a b-c
00574 */
00575 M_INLINE TREENODE *TREE_postorder_next(TREENODE *current, TREENODE *prev)
00576 {
00577 
00578         if (current->nextlevel_first && (!prev || current->parent == prev)) {
00579 next_level:
00580                 do {            
00581                         current = current->nextlevel_first;
00582                 }
00583                 while(current->nextlevel_first);
00584         } else {
00585                 if (current->right) {
00586                         current = current->right;
00587                         if (current->nextlevel_first) {
00588                           goto next_level;
00589                         }
00590                 } else {
00591                         if (current->parent) {
00592                                 current = current->parent;
00593                         }
00594                 }
00595         }
00596         return current;
00597 }

00605         current = TREE_postorder_next((tree),TREE_nextnode##prev);\
00606         if (current)\
00607                 for( TREE_nextnode##next =  TREE_postorder_next(current,TREE_nextnode##prev);\
00608                             (current) && current != (tree); \
00609                                 TREE_nextnode##prev = (current), \
00610                                 (current) = TREE_nextnode##next, \
00611                                 TREE_nextnode##next =  TREE_postorder_next(current,TREE_nextnode##prev)) {
00612

00631 M_INLINE void TREE_foreach_preorder(TREENODE *node, TREE_VISITOR_V visit, void *context)
00632 {
00633         TREENODE *current;
00634 
00635         TREE_FOREACH_PREORDER(current,node)
00636                 visit(node,context);
00637         TREE_FOREACH_POSTORDER_END
00638 }

00640 M_INLINE TREENODE * TREE_find_preorder(TREENODE *node, TREE_VISITOR visit, void *context)
00641 {
00642         TREENODE *current;
00643 
00644         TREE_FOREACH_PREORDER(current,node)
00645                 if (visit(node,context)) {
00646                         return current;
00647                 }

00708 /**
00709  * @brief check tree for consistency errors
00710  * @return 0 if the tree is inconsistent
00711  */
00712 M_INLINE int TREE_check_tree(TREENODE *root)
00713 {
00714         TREENODE *firstch = root->nextlevel_first;
00715 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00716         TREENODE *lastch   = root->nextlevel_last;
00717 #endif
00718 #ifndef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LEFT     
00719         TREENODE *slow,*fast, *next;
00720 #endif
00721 
00722         if (!firstch 
00723 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00724                         || !lastch
00725 #endif
00726                 ) {
00727 
00728 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00729                 if (firstch || lastch) {
00730                         return 0;
00731                 }
00732 #endif
00733                 return 1;               
00734         }       
00735         
00736         if (firstch->parent != root) {
00737                 return 0;
00738         }
00739 
00740 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LEFT      
00741         for(;;firstch = firstch->right) {
00742                 TREENODE *next;
00743                 
00744                 if (!firstch) {
00745                         return 0;
00746                 }
00747 
00748                 if (!TREE_check_tree(firstch)) {
00749                         return 0;
00750                 }
00751 
00752                 next = firstch->right;
00753                 if (!next) {
00754 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00755                         if (lastch != firstch) {
00756                                 return 0;
00757                         }
00758 #endif
00759                         break;
00760                 }
00761 
00762                 if (next->left != firstch) {
00763                         return 0;
00764                 }
00765         }
00766 #else
00767         slow=fast=firstch;
00768         while(1) {
00769                 if (!TREE_check_tree(slow)) {
00770                         return 0;
00771                 }
00772                 next = fast->right;
00773                 if (!next) {
00774                         break;                  
00775                 }
00776                 fast = next;
00777                 if (fast == slow) {
00778                         return 0;
00779                 }
00780                 next = fast->right;
00781                 if (!next) {
00782                         break;                  
00783                 }
00784                 fast = next;
00785                 if (fast == slow) {
00786                         return 0;
00787                 }
00788                 slow = slow->right;
00789         }
00790 #ifdef TREE_NEXTLEVEL_LAST
00791         if (lastch != fast) {
00792                 return 0;
00793         }
00794 #endif
00795 
00796 #endif
00797         return 1;
00798 }
00799 
00800 #ifdef  __cplusplus
00801 }
00802 #endif
00803 
00804 #endif
